Name: Perfluorooctanesulfonamide
Description: Perfluorooctanesulfonamide is a perfluorinated compound that is perfluorooctane in which one of the terminal fluorines has been replace by a sulfamoyl group. It has a role as a persistent organic pollutant. It is a sulfonamide and a perfluorinated compound.

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Hart K et al; Arch Environ Cont Toxicol 56: 607-14 (2009)  (2) Kannan K et al; Chemosphere 80: 613-8 (2010) (3) Kannan K et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 48: 559-66 (2005) (4) Keller JM et al; Environ Sci Technol 39: 9101-8 (2005) (5) Kelly BC et al; Environ Sci Technol 43: 4037-43 (2009) (6) Reiner JL et al; Environ Sci Technol 45: 8129-36 (2011) (7) Sinclair E et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 50: 298-410 (2006) (8) Tomy GT et al; Environ Sci Technol 38: 6475-81 (2004)
animal_concentrations.Value: Archived liver samples for northern sea otters from south-central Alaska had perfluorooctanesulfonamide concentrations of 2.3, 11.1, 5.2, 6.8, 9.8, 6.6, 15.2, 12.7, 3.3, 4.2, 2.3 and <1.7 ng/g wet weight in 1992, 1993, 1994, 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2001, 2002, 2003 and 2004 thru 2007, respectively(1). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (1.0 ng/g wet weight) in little brown bats (Myotis lucifugus) that had signs of white nose syndrome, collected from caves in eastern New York State from Feb to March 2008(2). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was found in mink liver, green frog liver and snapping turtle plasma at <2-181, <19 and <1-15.5, respectively, in samples taken from Michigan watersheds(3). One of 73 loggerhead turtles, caught off the US southeastern coast, contained perfluorooctanesulfonamide in its plasma at 61.1 pg/mL, six Kemp's ridley sea turtles were also tested, perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (detection limit 50 pg/mL) in any of these(4). Eider duck and white winged scoter liver samples, collected from the Hudson Bay region of northeastern Canada May to Sept 1999 to 2003, did not contain perfluorooctanesulfonamide (detection limit 0.03 ng/g wet weight)(5). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was detected in 27 beluga whale liver samples at 4.52-27.8 ng/g, collected from Cook Inlet, AK from 1992 to 2006 and in 41 beluga whale liver samples at 11.2-65.7 ng/g, collected from Chukchi Sea, AK from 1989 to 2000(6). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (detection limit 7.5 ng/g wet weight) in 87 waterfowl (20 common merganser, 2 hooded merganser, 3 bufflehead, 31 mallard, 1 surf scoter, 1 black duck, 20 common goldeneye, 2 greater scaup, 6 lesser scaup, 1 ring-neck) liver samples collected from the Niagara River region New York from 1994 to 2000(7). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was detected in five narwhal and five beluga sampled from the Arctic at 6.8-10.9 and 3.9-48.4 ng/g wet weight, respectively(8).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Kelly BC et al; Environ Sci Technol 43: 4037-43 (2009)
animal_concentrations.Value: Reported perfluorooctanesulfonamide concentrations in beluga whales collected from the Hudson Bay region of northeastern Canada May to Sept 1999 to 2003(1).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Berger U et al; Organohalogen Compounds 66: 4046-52 (2004) (2) Butt CM et al; Environ Sci Technol 41: 3521-8 (2007) (3) Falandysz J et al; Environ Sci Technol 40: 748-51 (2006) (4) Hart K et al; Environ Sci Technol 42: 7132-7 (2008) (5) Olivero-Verbel J et al; Environ Pollut 142: 367-72 (2006) (6) Quinete N et al; Chemosphere 77: 863-9 (2009) (7) Senthikumar K et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 79: 427-31 (2007) (8) Smithwick M et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 24: 981-6 (2005) (9) Smithwick M et al; Environ Sci Technol 39: 5517-23 (2005) (10) Tao L et al; Environ Sci Technol 40: 7642-8 (2006) (11) Yoo H et al; Environ Sci Technol 42: 5821-7 (2008)
animal_concentrations.Value: Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was detected in all the marine mammal (grey seal, minke whale, pilot whale) samples taken from Sweden, Denmark, Iceland and the Faeroe Islands(1). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (detection limit 2.3 ng/g wet weight) in thick-billed murres collected 1975 (5 samples), 1993 (10 samples) and 2004 (10 samples) all from Prince Leopold Island, Nunavut, Canada(2). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (detection limit 2.3 ng/g wet weight) in northern fulmars collected 1975 (9 samples), 1987 (8 samples) and 2003 (9 samples), but was detected in 10 northern fulmars collected in 1993 at concentrations of 0.18-5.3 ng/g wet weight(2). Blood samples from 16 eider duck (Sommateria mollisima), collected from the Gulf of Gdansk in Feb 2003, contained perfluorooctanesulfonamide at 100-800 pg/mL(3). The concentration of perfluorooctanesulfonamide in melon headed whales stranded along the Japanese coast was 6.0 to 12.3 ng/g wet weigh in 1982, 25.3 to 111 ng/g wet weight in 2001/2002 and 11.6 to 36.3 ng/g wet weight in 2006(4). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was detected in pelicans (Pelecanus occidentalis) collected from the Cartagena Bay, Columbia, Jan 12, 2004, at 1.0-1.8, <1-2.2, <1, <1-1.5, <1-1, <1 and <1-2.7 ng/g wet weight in brain, muscle, heart, lung, spleen, liver and kidney, respectively(5). Dolphin samples from Paraiba do Sul River, Brazil had perfluorooctanesulfonamide concentrations of 3.38-60.5, 7.58 and 16.0 ng/g wet weight in liver, muscle and kidney tissue, respectively(6). Livers from five cormorants, two raccoon dogs, two large-bill crows, and two eagles collected from Kyoto, Japan had perfluorooctanesulfonamide concentrations of 87-362, 3.7-14, 0.31-1.7, and 30-59 ng/g wet weight, respectively(7). Liver samples from 29 polar bear captured in eastern Greenland contained a mean concentration of 28 ng/g wet weight of perfluorooctanesulfonamide(8). The mean concentration of perfluorooctanesulfonamide was <1.7-71.5 ng/g wet weight in liver tissue from polar bears collected at seven locations in the North American and European Arctic(9). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected in Laysan albatross liver, serum or whole egg samples or in black-footed albatross whole egg or egg yolk samples, albatross were collected from the Atlantic and India southern oceans(10). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (detection limit 0.8 ng/g wet weight) in 17 little ringed plover and seven parrot bill but was detected in 40% of 20 little egret egg yolks at <0.8-4.7 ng/g wet weight, samples were collected around Lake Shihwa, Korea in May 2006(11).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Ahrens L et al; Environ Sci Technol 45: 8090-7 (2011)
animal_concentrations.Value: Temporal trends of perfluorooctanesulfonamide levels in tawny owl (Strix aluco) eggs collected from Central Norway were examined over a 24 year period(1).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Furdui VI et al; Environ Sci Technol 42: 4739-44 (2008) (2) Kannan K et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 48: 559-66 (2005) (3) Kelly BC et al; Environ Sci Technol 43: 4037-43 (2009) (4) Sinclair E et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 50: 398-410 (2006)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was detected in all trout samples taken from Lake Ontario in a trend study done from 1979 to 2004(1). The concentration peaked in 1993 at about 3 ng/g (detection limit 1.8 pg/g)(1). Fish from Michigan waters did not contain perfluorooctanesulfonamide (<19 ng/g wet weight)(2). Fish samples, collected from the Hudson Bay region of northeastern Canada May to Sept 1999 to 2003, had the following perfluorooctanesulfonamide concentrations: 71% of capelin (whole body) at 0.17-3.2 ng/g, 100% of cod (muscle) at 0.44-4.9 ng/g and 67% of salmon (muscle) at 0.09-4.7 ng/g(3). Largemouth bass caught from lakes throughout New York from 2001 to 2003 had perfluorooctanesulfonamide concentrations of <1.5-7.6 ng/g wet weight in the liver, smallmouth bass taken in the same survey had liver concentrations of <1.5-11.4 ng/g wet weight(4).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Kannan K et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 48: 559-66 (2005)

fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was detected in all freshwater fish (pike, perch, burbot, trout) samples taken from Finland, Sweden and Norway with the highest concentration reported in pike from Norway at a concentration of 141 ng/g wet weight(1). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was also detected in all marine water fish (cod, flounder, eelpout, herring, long rough dab, sculpin, dab, arctic char) samples from Sweden, Denmark, Iceland and the Faeroe Islands(1). Blood samples from 18 cod (Gadus morhua), collected from the Gulf of Gdansk in Feb 2003, contained perfluorooctanesulfonamide at 1200-13,000 pg/mL(2). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected in fish bile from mullet (Mugil incilis) collected from Cartagena Bay, Totumo Marsh or Covenas off the northern coast of Columbia, samples were collected in Dec 2003(3). Ten herring, about the size a common guillemot would eat, sampled from Landsort, Baltic Sea in 2005 contained perfluorooctanesulfonamide at concentrations of 0.12 to 0.41 ng/g wet weight(4). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was detected in mussel and oyster samples collected from the east Chinese coast at 37.8-287.7 ng/g wet weight (297.6-2247.7 ng/g dry weight) and at 2957.0 ng/g wet weight (19,201.3 ng/g dry weight) in mussel and oyster samples taken from Tokyo Bay, Japan(5). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (detection limit 0.035 ng/g) in zooplankton, clams, shrimp, Arctic cod or redfish(6).
The concentration of perfluorooctanesulfonamide was reported in fish sampled from Lake Vattern, Sweden and the Baltic Sea in 2001 with the following results in ng/g fresh weight(1).

fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (detection limit 0.73 ng/g wet weight) in brown mussels from Guanabara Bay, Brazil. Fish samples from Paraiba do Sul River and Guanavara Bay, Brazil tested positive for perfluorooctanesulfonamide. Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not analyzed in kidney samples for scabbardfish or croaker(1).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Kelly BC et al; Environ Sci Technol 43: 4037-43 (2009) (2) Nakata H et al; Environ Sci Technol 40; 4916-21 (2006) (3) Senthikumar K et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 79: 27-31 (2007)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: Sediment samples, collected from the Hudson Bay region of northeastern Canada May to Sept 1999 to 2003, had perfluorooctanesulfonamide concentrations in 22% of <0.01-0.04 ng/g dry weight(1). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was not detected (detection limit 1.5 ng/g dry weight) in five sediment samples taken from the Ariake Sea in Jan 2004(2). Perfluorooctanesulfonamide was detected in river sediments at <0.1-6.5 ng/g dry weight in samples from five rivers in Kyoto, Japan, samples were collected Dec 2003 and Feb and March 2005(3).
